intro: Gaura suffulta, commonly known as the showy gaura, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Polemoniaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and clusters of pink to white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist to wet habitats such as swamps and marshes. Its foliage is usually lance-shaped and has a soft, hairy texture. Gaura suffulta is valued in gardens for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in partially shaded conditions.
